clinical_study.brief_title: Diagnostic Performance of Deep Learning for Angle Closre
clinical_study.official_title: Diagnostic Performance of Deep Convolutional Neural Networks for Angle Closre Glaucoma: an International Multicenter Study

brief_summary.textblock: Primary angle closure diseases (PACD) are commonly seen in Asia. In clinical practice, gonioscopy is the gold standard for angle width classification in PACD patietns. However, gonioscopy is a contact examination and needs a long learning curve. Anterior segment optical coherence tomography (AS-OCT) is a non-contact test which can obtain three dimensional images of the anterior segment within seconds. Therefore, the investigators designed the study to verify if AS-OCT based deep learning algorithm is able to detect the PACD subjects diagnosed by gonioscopy.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately after obtaining the AS-OCT images
primary_outcome.description: AUC value of the automated algorithm in angle width classfication and synechia detection

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately after obtaining the AS-OCT images
secondary_outcome.description: Sensitivity and specificity of the automated algorithm in angle width classfication and synechia detection

intervention.intervention_name: Deep learning algorithm based on AS-OCT
intervention.description: The OCT scans of study subjects would be imported into the algorithm. Automated classfication of angle width and detection of synechia would be performed by the algorithm. The diagnostic performance of the algorithm would be compared with gonioscopy records.
